title: Astra seeks strategic investors as cash reserves decrease
summary: As Astra shifts resources from launch vehicle development to spacecraft thruster production, the company is actively seeking strategic investors to provide longer-term support.

title: Maui truthers are so dumb they’re using a Falcon 9 photo as wildfire evidence
summary: You can always count on conspiracy theorists to make a tragedy worse.

title: NRO to select providers of new forms of optical satellite imagery
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is soliciting proposals from commercial remote-sensing companies that use optical imaging satellites.

title: Arianespace to Launch Europe’s Final Mission of 2023 Aboard Vega in September
summary:
After ESA confirmed Ariane 6 would not debut until 2024 and the return to flight of Vega C suffered a setback following a failed test, it appears that Europe can look forward to just one more launch in 2023. The Arianespace-managed mission will be launched will be aboard a Vega rocket and is scheduled to […]
The post Arianespace to Launch Europe’s Final Mission of 2023 Aboard Vega in September appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: US Space Force Retires Classified Surveillance Satellite & Orders Replacement
summary: A geosynchronous surveillance satellite, part of the Geosynchronous Space Situational Awareness Program (GSSAP) operated by the U.S. Space Force, has been retired after completing an exceptional eight-year mission in orbit.

title: SDA Looks To Change How US Military Buys Satellites
summary: For decades, the Pentagon's massive space budget has been primarily allocated to traditional geostationary satellites; but the four-year-old Space Development Agency (SDA) is looking to revolutionize this approach.

title: Weekly Space Recap: August 7 – August 13
summary: Here are some of the stories you may have missed in the past week. The second week of August 2023 featured updates...

title: NASA Invites Media to Psyche Launch, Mission will Study an Asteroid
summary: Media accreditation is now open for the upcoming launch of NASA’s Psyche spacecraft, for a mission to a unique metal-rich asteroid orbiting the Sun between Mars and Jupiter.

title: La NASA invita a los medios al lanzamiento de Psyche
summary: Ya está abierto el proceso de acreditación de los medios de comunicación para el próximo lanzamiento de la nave espacial Psyche de la NASA en su misión a un asteroide único y rico en metales que orbita alrededor del Sol, entre Marte y Júpiter.

title: Interstellar Technologies Prepares for ZERO Static Fire, Target 2025 For Orbital Launch
summary: Interstellar Technologies is gearing up for a crucial static fire test later this year, a significant step toward launching their Zero rocket into orbit by 2025.
